abstract: Side Street column; Dr Robert Gore, physician at trauma center at Kings County Hospital Center in Brooklyn, has begun mentorship program Kings Against Violence Initiative; project seeks to stem violence that leads to injuries he see in his line of work; Gore,who is black and grew up in Brooklyn, has special connection to communities he seeks to help.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Robert Gore of Kings County Hospital Center helped start a mentoring program intended to teach teenagers that while conflict may not be avoidable, violence is.

headline.main: In Fight to Save Young People, Brooklyn Doctor Treats Violence as a Public Health Issue
headline.print_headline: Trying a Preventive Approach to Quell the Violence of the Streets

snippet: Dr. Robert Gore of Kings County Hospital Center helped start a mentoring program intended to teach teenagers that while conflict may not be avoidable, violence is.
